channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump plans to name Rep. Mike Waltz as national security adviser
item.description: As national security adviser, the Florida congressman would play a key role in shaping U.S. policy on geopolitical conflicts ranging from the war in Ukraine to the war between Israel and Hamas in Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
As national security adviser, the Florida congressman would play a key role in shaping U.S. policy on geopolitical conflicts ranging from the war in Ukraine to the war between Israel and Hamas in Gaza.

(Image credit: Riccardo Savi)
item.dc:creator: Jason Breslow

item.title: This coffee shop brings veterans together and holds years of military artifacts
item.description: A coffee shop in a small town in North Carolina has become a place for veterans to get together while also serving as a museum of sorts, as it holds photos and medals from the past 100 years.
item.content:encoded: A coffee shop in a small town in North Carolina has become a place for veterans to get together while also serving as a museum of sorts, as it holds photos and medals from the past 100 years.
item.dc:creator: Nick de la Canal

item.title: Trump picks former Rep. Lee Zeldin to be his EPA administrator
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump said the New York Republican would help push deregulation and support American businesses. Environmental groups decried the nomination.
item.content:encoded:
President-elect Donald Trump said the New York Republican would help push deregulation and support American businesses. Environmental groups decried the nomination.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: Haiti swears in a new leader as gangs shoot at a flight landing in the main airport
item.description: Haiti's international airport shut down temporarily after gangs opened fire at a Spirit Airlines flight landing in Port-Au-Prince. The latest violence came as a new prime minister was sworn in.
item.content:encoded:
Haiti's international airport shut down temporarily after gangs opened fire at a Spirit Airlines flight landing in Port-Au-Prince. The latest violence came as a new prime minister was sworn in.

(Image credit: Odelyn Joseph)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: You might beat back phragmites, the scourge of wetlands, but then what?
item.description: Wetlands managers have spent years using fire and chemicals to fight phragmites, an invasive reed that chokes everything else out. But coaxing beneficial native plants to move back in is difficult.
item.content:encoded: Wetlands managers have spent years using fire and chemicals to fight phragmites, an invasive reed that chokes everything else out. But coaxing beneficial native plants to move back in is difficult.
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: 25 of 43 monkeys have been recovered after escaping a lab in South Carolina last week
item.description: A research facility in Yemassee, S.C., has recovered 25 of the 43 monkeys that escaped from the laboratory last week after a caretaker accidentally left the door to their enclosure unsecured.
item.content:encoded:
A research facility in Yemassee, S.C., has recovered 25 of the 43 monkeys that escaped from the laboratory last week after a caretaker accidentally left the door to their enclosure unsecured.

(Image credit: John Raoux)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Stephen Miller is heading back to the White House as Trump's deputy chief of staff
item.description: One of the architects of Trump's family separation policy during his first time in office, Miller will return to the White House in a key role.
item.content:encoded:
One of the architects of Trump's family separation policy during his first time in office, Miller will return to the White House in a key role.

(Image credit: Michael Ciaglo)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: A 'Wicked' mistake: Mattel apologizes for printing a porn site on its doll packaging
item.description: Mattel is pulling its Wicked dolls from some store shelves because of a misprint directing shoppers to a pornographic site. Meanwhile, resellers are listing the products on eBay for up to $500.
item.content:encoded:
Mattel is pulling its Wicked dolls from some store shelves because of a misprint directing shoppers to a pornographic site. Meanwhile, resellers are listing the products on eBay for up to $500.

(Image credit: Jordan Strauss)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Taurid meteor shower to light up the night sky. Here's how you can see it
item.description: The North and South Taurids occur every year in September, October, and November. They may have originated from a comet that broke up about 10,000 years ago.
item.content:encoded:
The North and South Taurids occur every year in September, October, and November. They may have originated from a comet that broke up about 10,000 years ago.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Trump plans to revoke many Biden policies. Where does that leave marijuana?
item.description: The president-elect recently affirmed that he supports legalizing marijuana for recreational use. His stance means cannabis could be a rare issue on which Trump carries a Biden policy forward.
item.content:encoded:
The president-elect recently affirmed that he supports legalizing marijuana for recreational use. His stance means cannabis could be a rare issue on which Trump carries a Biden policy forward.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell
